Text:
The following dayâ€”Cid, having lost a portion of
his memory, is situated in a room inside the
organization's premises.
Master Cid, I've brought your breakfast.
Oh, yeah, thanks. You're...Beta, right?
Y-You remember my name? Has your memory returned?!

Huh? Oh, no. I just remember you being called that
yesterday.
Oh... Right...

Let me to reintroduce myself. My name is Beta.
I'll be looking after you today.

Do you need anything? If something's bothering you,
just let me know, and I'll handle it right away.

I'm good for now. The room comes with a toilet and
shower, after all.
Though, not being able to leave is kind of a drag...

I'm sorry. Given your memory loss, we can't show you
everything inside the building...

So, this place really is that confidential? It's called the
ancient city of Alexandria, right?
I can't disclose those details...

What about the girls I met yesterday? There were
seven, including you, right?
Are they members of this organization?
...I can't comment on that either.

So, why am I here? And what's our relationship?
You're not going to tell me that either?
I sincerely apologize...
Then, what's my relationship with you?
Huh...?

Is it just a coincidence you're the first to come
see me? Or...is there some special reason?
Um... Well... Well...
Well?
...I'll be honest with you.

Beta smiles gently, taking a step toward Cid.
Her cheeks are tinted pink.
Our relationship, Master Cid...

It's personal, outside of the organization. What I
mean is, um... We have a special...mutual desire for
each other, kind of like an...intimate relationship...
Hmm. I see.

Exactly! So, for the sake of our future together,
let's do our best to help you regain your memory!

Beta clasps both of Cid's hands tightly. Meeting her
eyes as she smiles warmly at him, Cid offers a slight
nod.
The next day...

Good morning, Master Cid! I'm Epsilon! I'll be the
one looking after you today.
Epsilon...? Oh, right, nice to meet you...

You seem confused. Do you find my presence
dissatisfactory?

Epsilon gazes at Cid with teary eyes. He hastily
shakes his head.

No, it's not that. I knew there would be someone
different each day, but I kind of thought Beta
would come again today...
Beta?

At the mention of Beta's name, Epsilon's tears
vanish.
...Why would you think that?
Huh? Well...uh... How can I put it...
Have you taken a liking to that air...I mean, woman?

Wait, that woman... Did she do something to you
yesterday, Master Cid?! Did she provide some
special service that's made you want her back
today?!
No, no! It's not like that!

(There's some kind of huge misunderstanding!
...Fine I should just be honest.)

The truth is...according to Beta, we're in an
intimate relationship.

...Excuse me? An intimate relationship? Is that what
Beta said?

More precisely, she said, "It's personal, outside of
the organization. We have a special mutual desire
for each other, kind of like an intimate relationship..."

Hearing Cid's honest confession, Epsilon, whose
expression had been blank, breaks into a smile.
Master Cid, that's a misunderstanding.
...Huh?

When she said "kind of like" an intimate relationship,
she just meant it bears some "vague resemblance"â€”
nothing like the real thing.
You mean, it was just a metaphor?
Exactly.

Epsilon confirms firmly before letting out a deep
sigh.

She often does that. Exaggerates both her stories and
her breasts...
...Her stories and her breasts?

That's right. So, please don't believe everything you
hear. As for me, you can trust me. Because...

We have a pure and honest relationship. There are no
lies between us. And, unlike her, I'm all natural.

But, despite my appearance, I'm actually super
reserved...and yet, a part of me yearns for a
passionate bond with you, Master Cid.

Heheh... Now, is that a metaphor or not? Which do you
think it is, Master Cid? Only kidding...

(I was too distracted by the magic she uses on her
breasts to properly listen. It's way over the top...
No, I shouldn't say anything.)

(That said, whether it's Beta yesterday or Epsilon
today, they're providing minimum information and
seem to be blending in some falsehoods.)

(While I don't sense malice or ill-intent...it's
dangerous to trust them too much.)

Recognizing his inability to fully comprehend the
situation, Cid concludes he shouldn't rashly
antagonize the seven girls.

However, he also realizes he shouldn't fully trust
them. With this in mind, Cid opts to cautiously
interact with the seven girls...
